messages.message: On aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com (http://aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com) when I navigate to *Apps* > *Build*, I can’t use the _back_ button in my browser (Chrome) to get back to the *Apps* page. I don’t have the same problem when clicking _back_ from *Apps* > *Converse* or any of the other custom apps available, just when trying with *Build*. If I click _back_ repeatedly, the URL briefly flashes as https://aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com/hub/build/projects but then immediately reverts to and stays stuck on https://aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com/hub/build/{project-ID}. I can still use buttons in the UI to get back to *Apps* so it’s not a blocker obviously, but it’s odd.

For that matter I’m also encountering it when accessing *Build* from the *Explore* page. Clicking _back_ repeatedly in this case though sometimes briefly flashes the Explore page but then I stay stuck on the project page.

yup thanks for pointing out @Rosie, we’re aware of this! @CJ what we’re currently doing is having the build app direct to `/build/projects` which finds the most recent project and re-directs. So anytime the user clicks the back button it’s immediately getting re-directed back to the project. What we should instead do is what converse does and pre-fetch the most recent project Id and have the buttons go straight to that project
@CJ yep, that's the bug I sent to <#C05EQQJGN7L|> earlier.
